CONDUCTOR WALKED THE TRAIN AND FOUND THAT CARS 72-79 HAD DERAILED JUST SOUTHOF THE NM176 GRADE CROSSING. PRELIM. INVESTIGATION SHOWS 72ND CAR DERAILED DUE TO WIDE GAUGE. 09111-d-10-17-09-ARR.Accident Cause: Improper operation of train line air connections  (bottling the air)
09111-d-10-17-09-ARR.Narrative: HOSTLERS ON JOB 639, ON DUTY 5:00. WERE REQUIRED TO MOVE ARR LOCOMOTIVE 3009 FROM INSIDE BACK SHOP TRACK 2 ASSEMBLE A CONSIST WITH ARR 3010.  WHEN MOVING ARR 3009, AIR BRAKE  CONTROLS WERE CONDITIONEDWITH THE AUTOMATIC BRAKE CUTOUT AND HANDLE PLACED IN HANDLE OFF POSITION.  INDEPENDENT BRAKE WAS INLEAD. RELEASED AND BLOCKED IN THE ACTUATION TO PREVENT ANY BUILDUP OF BRAKE CYLINDER PRESSURE FROMANY MEANS.  THE LOCOMOTIVE CONTROLLING THE MOVEMENT ARR 3010 AIR BRAKE EQUIPMENT WAS CONDITIONED TOBE A TRAILING UNIT WITH THE AUTOMATIC BRAKE CUTOUT AND THE INDEPENDENT BRAKE TO SET THE TRAIL POSITION.  MU AIR HOSES WERE THEN CONNECTED AND CUTOUT COCKS OPENED WHICH ALLOWED THE BRAKES ON THE LOCOMOTIVES TO RELEASE.  AFTER THE LOCOMOTIVE BRAKES RELEASED BOTH LOCOMOTIVES BEGAN MOVING SOUTHWARD ON BACK SHOP TRACK 2 AND COLLIDED WITH THE CLOSED SHOP DOOR CAUSING EXTENSIVE DAMAGES TO THE DOOR AND ARR 3009 THAT EXCEEDS THE FRA REPORTABLE THRESHOLD ON OR ABOUT 6:10 P.M., OCTOBER 17, 2009.

10092009A-d-10-09-09-TMBL.Contributing Accident Cause: Shoving movement, man on or at leading end of movement, failure to control
10092009A-d-10-09-09-TMBL.Narrative: TWO AUTO RACKS COLLIDED ON THE EAST END OF TRACKS 33 & 34.  THE SWITCH FOREMAN DIRECTED A MOVE INTOTRACK 33.  HE WENT BETWEEN TWO CARS, "BOTTLED THE AIR" AND THEN PROCEEDED TO WALK TOWARD THE AREA HEWANTED TO MAKE A CUT.  HE MISTAKENLY MADE THE CUT WITH AN EXTRA CAR IN TRACK 33 WITHOUT REALIZING IT WAS OUT TO FOUL.  THE CREW THEN SAT A CAR OVER TO TRACK 28.  THE CAR THAT WAS SUPPOSED TO GO TO TRACK 28 WAS THE EXTRA CAR LEFT ON TRACK 33 OUT TO FOUL.  WHEN HE COMPLETED THE MOVE INTO TRACK 28 HELINED THE CUT INTO TRACK 34 THINKING HE WAS IN THE CLEAR.  HE DIRECTED THE ENGINEER BACK ON THE RADIO WITH THE LOCOMOTIVE & THREE CARS.  WHEN THE LEAD LOAD STARTED INTO TRACK 34, IT COLLIDED WITH THEEMPTY HOMESHOP AUTO RACK OUT TO FOUL ON THE EAST END OF TRACK 33.  THE FOREMAN WAS WALKING ON THE OUTSIDE OF THE LEADING EDGE GOING INTO TRACK 34 BETWEEN TRACKS 34 & 34 AND WAS NOT IN POSITION TO SEETHE LEADING EDGE COME TOO CLOSE TO TRACK 33.  IT WASN'T UNTIL IT WAS DISCOVERED THAT THE EAST CAR INTRACK 33 HAD AN OPEN ANGLE COCK THAT HE LOOKED CLOSER AND REALIZED HE HAD BOTTLED THE AIR ON ALL THE CARS BEHIND THE EMPTY RACK OUT TO FOUL AND HE HAD PUT THE WRONG CAR INTO TRACK 28.  THE EMPTY RACK'S ANGLE COCK WAS OPEN AND IT HAD LOST AIR AND SET UP THE BRAKES SO THE CUT HAD NOT MOVED.

E28091-03 DID RECEIVED PERMISSION TO ENTER THE LIMITS OF  L50591-03 HAD TRACK AUTHORITY ON MAIN 2 AT MP21-22.  THE ENGINEER AND CONDUCTOR WERE TRANSPORTED TO ST. JAMES HOSPITAL FOR INJURIES SUSTAINED.  INVESTIGATION FOUND THAT L50591-03 HAD ACCIDENTLY LINED THE MATTESON YARD LEAD SWITCH OFF MAIN 2 IN REVERSE ALLOWING E28091-03 INTO THE YARD INSTEAD OF CONTINUING ON THE MAIN TRACK.  TESTING WAS DONE ON THE EMPLOYEES INVOLVED WITH POSITIVE RESULTS ON ONE ALCOHOL TEST.

I0209-d-10-21-09-PATH.Narrative:
AT 7:59 AM, A SEVEN-CAR PA-5 CAR TRAIN (CONSIST: N- 5612-5100-5107-5604-5607-5106-5606) LEFT HOBOKENTERMINAL, EN-ROUTE TO 33RD STREET TERMINAL.  THE TRAIN OPERATED NORTH, STOPPING AT CHRISTOPHER STREET, 9TH STREET, 14TH STREET, AND 23RD STREET STATIONS WITHOUT INCIDENT.  DURING THE TRIP, THE ELECTRO-PNEUMATIC TRAIN LINE SYSTEMS OPERATED AS DESIGNED, AND THE ENGINEER DID NOT EXPERIENCE ANY BRAKINGPROBLEMS WITH THE TRAIN.   THE TRAIN REPORTEDLY MADE PROPER STATION STOPS, AND THE CONDUCTOR’S OPERATING POSITION IN THE TRAIN ALIGNED WITH THE 7 CAR MARKER AT EACH OF THE STATIONS.  

THE TRAIN LEFT 23RD STREET STATION AT APPROXIMATELY 0811 HOURS, AND PROCEEDED NORTH TOWARD 33RD  STREET STATION.THE TRAIN ACCELERATED, REACHING A MAXIMUM SPEED OF APPROXIMATELY 23 MPH IN THE TUNNEL BETWEEN 23RDSTREET AND 33RD STREET STATIONS.  DURING THIS SEGMENT OF THE TRIP, THE SPEED VARIED BETWEEN THE TWOSTATIONS AS THE TRAIN COASTED, BRAKED TO APPROXIMATELY 8 MPH, AND THEN ACCELERATED ONCE AGAIN TO 17MPH.  UPON APPROACH TO SIGNALS 195-Z AND 195-Z REPEATER, THE TRAIN SLOWED TO 7 MPH.  AS IT ENTERED33RD STREET STATION, THE TRAIN CONTINUED AT 7 MPH PAST TIMING SIGNAL 197-Z.

THE TRAIN PASSED TIMING SIGNAL 197-Z, AND THE ENGINEER STARTED TO ACCELERATE WHILE CONTINUING INTO THE STATION.  THE TRAIN REACHED A MAXIMUM SPEED OF 15 MPH.  THE ENGINEER THEN PLACED THE MASTER CONTROLLER INTO THE “MINIMUM BRAKE,” “FULL SERVICE BRAKE,” AND “EMERGENCY BRAKE” POSITIONS IN QUICK SUCCESSION.  WHILE IN THE

895-d-10-17-09-VTR.Narrative: PROCEEDING SOUTH FROM CAMP GROUND CROSSING.  AS I WAS APPROACHING FISHERS CROSSING (MI 91367) I TURNED TO CHECK SPEED AND GAUGES WHEN I TURNED BACK I SAW A TRACTOR CROSSING THE TRACKS AT FISHER CROSSING.  I  DUMPED THE AIR AND BLEW THE HORN CONTINUALLY TILL THE TRAIN CAME TO A STOP 312 FEET SOUTH OFTHE CROSSING. WENT BACK TO CHECK PASSENGERS AND THE PERSON IN THE TRACTOR WERE OK.  I IMMEDIATELY CALLED VRS EMERGENCY NUMBER DISPATCHER ANSWERED AND STAYED ON THE PHONE WITH ME TILL WE FOUND OUT WHETHER WE NEEDED ANY EMERGENCY PEOPLE OR EQUIPMENT.  NO ONE WAS HURT NOR NEEDED MEDICAL ATTENTION.  ITHEM CALLED AND THEN THE FARMER CALLED THE STATE POLICE AND FIRE DEPT. WHOM WHERE ON THE SCENE WITHIN 10 MINUTES.  TALKED WITH THE DRIVER OF THE TRACTOR WHO SAID HE DIDN'T SEE US TILL I STARTED TO BLOW THE HORN HE ALSO TOLD THAT HE NAILED THE THROTTLE IN AN ATTEMPT TO GET ACROSS FASTER.  FROM MY PERSPECTIVE IT APPEARED THE TRACTOR MOVED AT A CONSTANT SPEED WHILE CROSSING THE CROSSING.
